pr_title: Fix class resolve for VT multianewarray

timeline.message:
Adding test for MultiNewArray

Create ValueType test to check that arrays made using MULTIANEWARRAY
do not have null as the default value.

Testing two paths:
- Using Array.instance()
- Using opcode for MULTIANEWARRAY

Related to: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/10077

Signed-off-by: Oussama Saoudi <oussama.saoudi@ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: youre not making an array here, need makePointArray instead of makePoint2D
timeline.author: tajila

timeline.bodyText: also you dont need to generate code for getters and setters, since Array.get will do the same thing
timeline.author: tajila

timeline.message:
Adding test for MultiNewArray

Create ValueType test to check that arrays made using MULTIANEWARRAY
do not have null as the default value. Added multianewarray creation
for Valuetypes.

Testing two paths:
- Using Array.instance()
- Using opcode for MULTIANEWARRAY

Added support for multianewarray bytecode operation on Q types by
modifying the interalFindArrayClass method in classsupport.c.

Related to: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/10077

Signed-off-by: Oussama Saoudi <oussama.saoudi@ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: nitpick: please rename to test2DMultiANewArray(cw, className); for consistency
timeline.author: tajila

timeline.bodyText: you should also pass in isRef
timeline.author: tajila

timeline.bodyText: so it can be used here, so L is used for ref, and Q for values
timeline.author: tajila

timeline.bodyText: same thing here with the name
timeline.author: tajila

timeline.bodyText: for this test and the ones below, you can first do a loop write out each element with defaultLinePositions1 (look at checkFieldAccessMHOfAssortedType) and then do another loop to compare that it is correct with checkFieldAccessMHOfAssortedType. Look at testGCFlattenedValueArrayWithSingleAlignment for an example.
timeline.author: tajila

still working on things

Fix class resolve for VT multianewarray

Create ValueType test to check that multiarrays made using
MULTIANEWARRAY bytecode and Array.newInstance() correctly
store flattened types. Added multianewarray creation for
Valuetypes.

Testing two paths:
- Using Array.instance()
- Using opcode for MULTIANEWARRAY

Tested following types:
- Point2D
- FlattenedLine2D
- Triangle2D
- AssortedValueWithLongAlginment

NOTE: AssortedValueWithLongAlignment tests fail in ValueTypeTests_1
and ValueTypeTests_2 due to array flattening enabled.

Added support for multianewarray bytecode operation on Q types by
modifying the interalFindArrayClass method in classsupport.c.

Related to: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/10077

Signed-off-by: Oussama Saoudi <oussama.saoudi@ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: @tajila This test concerns default values. Should I remove or modify it?
timeline.author: OussamaSaoudi

timeline.message:
Fix class resolve for VT multianewarray

Create ValueType test to check that multiarrays made using
MULTIANEWARRAY bytecode and Array.newInstance() correctly
store flattened types. Added multianewarray creation for
Valuetypes.

Testing two paths:
- Using Array.instance()
- Using opcode for MULTIANEWARRAY

Tested following types:
- Point2D
- FlattenedLine2D
- Triangle2D
- AssortedValueWithLongAlginment

NOTE: AssortedValueWithLongAlignment tests fail in ValueTypeTests_1
and ValueTypeTests_2 due to array flattening enabled.

Added support for multianewarray bytecode operation on Q types by
modifying the interalFindArrayClass method in classsupport.c.

Related to: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/10077

Signed-off-by: Oussama Saoudi <oussama.saoudi@ibm.com>

- Using Array.instance()
- Using opcode for MULTIANEWARRAY

Tested following types:
- Point2D
- FlattenedLine2D
- Triangle2D
- AssortedValueWithLongAlginment

NOTE: AssortedValueWithLongAlignment tests fail in ValueTypeTests_1
and ValueTypeTests_2 due to array flattening enabled.

Added support for multianewarray bytecode operation on Q types by
modifying the interalFindArrayClass method in classsupport.c.

Related to: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/10077
